geninfo.para: This TSI letter identifies the recommended TOE, CAMBER and CASTER settings for front wheel alignment on vehicles built by International Truck and Engine Corporation®.

table.title: Toe-In For All Steer Axles- No Load

note.para: Camber is predrilled in the I-beam by the supplier, and within the following specifications, and is not an issue in tire tread life or handling on North American highways. Cold inflation and toe-in are the prime factors in tread life.
International® and its suppliers will not approve adjusting CAMBER by bending the I-beam.

table.title: Front Non-Drive Steer Axle Camber Specifications

para.emph: Front Drive Steer Axle Camber Tolerance:

note.para: Caster is controlled by factory installed wedges between the springs and axle. Caster set too low for a specific vehicle may result in wander or returnability complaints.

table.title: Front Non-Drive Steer Axle Caster Specifications

note.para: The right caster angle should be equal to or greater (more positive) than the left caster angle, but not exceeding 1 degree greater.

table.title: Front Drive Steer Axle Caster Specifications
